Olivo is the oldest olive grove in Wairarapa,
New Zealand
. Situated three kilometres outside of
Martinborough , the grove currently has 1200 olive trees of the Barnea, Manzanillo, Leccino and Frantoio varieties planted on 12 acres of land. Olivo's olive oil has also won many awards in both local and regional competitions. These include gold medal for both the national and local competitions for the Extra Virgin olive oil section.
History
Olivo was first planted in 1991 by the Lochie family, and now is owned by the Meehan family. As previously mentioned, it was the pioneering olive grove in the Wairarapa, and also is one of the oldest and most established brands in New Zealand. Olivo enjoyed a rebranding in 2005 giving the bottles the look they currently have today.
Grove experience
Visitors to Olivo can enjoy a short tour of the grove and a tasting at the newly-built tasting room on weekends, public holidays and at other times by arrangement. Also tour groups are welcome for a small charge (which can include a delicious local morning tea!)
